name: Jonathan
message: There's nobody here.

name: Cordelia
message: Of course not.
The door was properly locked too.

name: Thomas
message: More importantly, let's hurry up and have a drink.

name: Cordelia
message: I'm going to go change, so wait a sec, okay?
Sit at the Table.

name: Jonathan
message: Isn't it kinda pointless to go out of your way to change clothes？
We're just gonna have a drink anyway.

name: Cordelia
message: That's not how it works.
When I'm standing behind the bar, I'm not my usual self.

name: Jonathan
message: You're pretty nitpicky, huh.

name: Cordelia
message: But I mean, I live right above here, you know？
If I don't do it like this, we won't be able to put an end to it, right?

name: Jonathan
message: I guess that's how it is.
She's downing straight Scotch like it's just drinking water.
For this guy, it probably doesn't matter whether it's water or whiskey.
Doesn't look tired at all.
He looks so lively, you wouldn't believe he's that old.

name: Cordelia
message: Hey, Jonathan......

name: Jonathan
message: What's wrong？

name: Cordelia
message: Will you come to my room tonight？
At the same time as yesterday.

name: Jonathan
message: Why? We're going around the village together again tomorrow, aren't we?
It doesn't have to be tonight, does it?

name: Cordelia
message: That's true, but......

name: Jonathan
message: I didn't sleep much yesterday, so if possible, I'd like to get a little rest.

name: Cordelia
message: Please, if you want, you can even use my bed by yourself.

name: Jonathan
message: So, where are you planning to sleep then？
I can't let you do something like that.

name: Cordelia
message: ‥‥‥‥ひとりじゃ寂しいのよ。
Haven't you been doing it all alone up until now?
そう言いたいところだが、やめておいた方が賢明だろう。

name: Jonathan
message: Got it.
It's the same time as yesterday......

name: Cordelia
message: 我侭言ってごめんなさい。

name: Cordelia
message: Jonathan, don't forget that promise, okay?

name: Jonathan
message: Promise？

name: Cordelia
message: Geez！
It's the same time as yesterday, don't forget.

name: Thomas
message: We really worked a lot today.
First we went to that crazy old man's house and dug through a pile of filthy books……

name: Jonathan
message: I’ve said it before, but it’s not like I asked you to come with me, you know.

name: Thomas
message: Just thinking about the inside of that filthy boat gives me the chills.
On top of that, we got covered in dust from all those books……

name: Jonathan
message: I don't think I'm the type to worry about stuff like that.

name: Thomas
message: I wanna hurry back to the Fish Scale Inn and change my clothes.
There's gotta be a laundry place in this village, right？

name: Thomas
message: What are we gonna do now？

name: Jonathan
message: What do you mean, how？
Ever since I got back from that old man's ship, my back's been feeling all itchy, you know.

name: Jonathan
message: Maybe it's just your imagination？
That sounds just like you're saying Old man Marsh keeps bugs or something.

name: Thomas
message: Hey, are you alright?
Then I guess it was just your imagination.

name: Thomas
message: Well, I just can't stand being in a filthy room like that.

name: Thomas
message: It's nice to have a drink while the sun's still high.
It's my hard-earned vacation, so that's how it should be.

name: Jonathan
message: We don't have time to mess around forever.
Because I have to go to Old man Marsh's place, you know.

name: Thomas
message: No need to rush things like that.
One　more　drink　should　be　fine,　right？

name: Gardner
message: Jonathan, about that guy Nai you met last night, the church was completely empty.

name: Jonathan
message: I wonder if it's really okay to call that place a Church.
Is something bothering you？

name: Gardner
message: No, it's true, you really can't call that an ordinary church.
I can't help but feel like it has some sort of connection to those ruins.

name: Jonathan
message: Now that you mention it, that temple-like thing in the ruins, it was clearly meant to enshrine something or someone.

name: Gardner
message: If the god they worship at that church is the same as the god from those ruins...

name: Gardner
message: I just can't help but have such selfish thoughts.
I really want to see this guy Nai's face at least once.

name: Jonathan
message: But since there's no one there, there's nothing we can do. If you want, should we go check it out again？

name: Jonathan
message: Professor, what do you think the church member meant by 'the last one left'?

name: Gardner
message: Well...
I think it's probably some kind of slang related to their religion...

name: Jonathan
message: It seems like it might be connected to the word 'chosen one' that the villager I met in the square mentioned.

name: Gardner
message: Yeah, I think so too. The 'chosen one' is guided by God, and the 'last one left' stays behind.

name: Gardner
message: Even considering that this guy Nai is in the special position of being a priest, there's nothing wrong with thinking of him as the person left with a special role in the end.

name: Gardner
message: Jonathan, about that guy named Nai you met last night, the church was totally empty.

name: Jonathan
message: I'm not sure if we can really call that place a Church.
Is something bothering you？

name: Gardner
message: No, honestly, you really can't call that a normal church.
I can't help but feel it's somehow connected to those ruins.

name: Jonathan
message: Now that you mention it, that temple-like thing in the ruins, it definitely looked like something was being worshipped there.

name: Gardner
message: If the god they worship at that church is the same as the one from those ruins...

name: Gardner
message: I can't help but think wishful things like “Gardner” and stuff.
I'd really love to get a look at the face of that guy called Nai.

name: Jonathan
message: But no one's here, so there's really nothing we can do.　　　　　If you want, should I go check again？

name: Jonathan
message: Professor, what does that 'Last One Left' the believer let slip at the Church really mean?

name: Gardner
message: Well......
I think it's some kind of jargon related to their religion...

name: Jonathan
message: Should we ask the old man Marsh？

name: Gardner
message: I don't really think that old man knows much about religion, though.
The　quickest　way　is　to　just　ask　a　believer.

name: Jonathan
message: But they didn’t want to say anything.
It’s not like I have anyone else to rely on either......

name: Gardner
message: Maybe I'll try looking for someone who might accidentally let something slip.　　　　　　　　Though I doubt there are that many fools like that just lying around.

name: Gardner
message: Come to think of it, didn't you say something weird this morning？

name: Jonathan
message: What are you talking about？

name: Gardner
message: I'm pretty sure... you said you saw something like a church somewhere last night. You also mentioned something about a Black priest, I think.

name: Jonathan
message: Oh, that?.
It is a weird story for sure, a Church without even a single Cross, and on top of that, some shady guy acting as the priest‥‥‥

name: Jonathan
message: The place... I think I can figure it out somehow, though.
Shall we go check it out？

name: Gardner
message: First, I gotta meet with old man Marsh.
That's the main reason for today, after all.

name: Gardner
message: Yeah, that's right.
If you got lost on the way here, you probably aren’t too far away, right？

name: Cordelia
message: Jonathan, what are we going to do now？

name: Jonathan
message: Yeah...

name: Jonathan
message: どうしてマーシュ老人がダニッジ事件にこだわるのか　　　　　　　　知っておきたいな。

name: Cordelia
message: So, you're going to Marsh's place, right？

name: Jonathan
message: ダニッジ家と縁があった修道院の跡も調べてみる必要　　　　　　　　がありそうだ。

name: Cordelia
message: The monastery, huh... If we leave at this time, the sun might set before we get there.

name: Jonathan
message: 事件が起きたダニッジ家の屋敷に行ってみるのもいい　　　　　　　　かもしれない。

name: Cordelia
message: But it's locked, you know.
Otherwise, guys like hyenas would just take everything away.

name: Jonathan
message: If I could get the key to the Dunwich Mansion somewhere...

name: Cordelia
message: Marsh's story was kinda really weird, wasn't it?

name: Jonathan
message: Seriously.
最初は『インスマウス顔』から始まったのに、気づい　　　　　　　　てみれば途方もない大きな話になってしまった。

name: Cordelia
message: とりあえず、資料館に行ってみるんでしょ？
If we look into the incident that made the Innsmouth look so hated, we might find something out.

name: Jonathan
message: But, the fact that my face looks like the guy who committed such a gruesome crime... that's not exactly a pleasant thought.

name: Cordelia
message: Yeah......
But　just　because　their　faces　look　alike,　it　doesn't　mean　they're　all　gonna　commit　cruel　incidents,　right？

name: Jonathan
message: Of course I do.
Do you really think I'm the kind of person who'd do something like that？

name: Cordelia
message: Jonathan, if you keep taking it so easy, Marsh　　　　　　　　-san is going to end up in a state where he can't even talk with us.

name: Jonathan
message: Is that old man really that much of a drunkard？

name: Cordelia
message: Most of the guys in this village are like that, though.
Marsh-san is like she's scared of something—she never lets go of her liquor bottles.

name: Jonathan
message: If we stay here too long, we'll probably get just as drunk as them.
Go outside
